trans-unit.source: Define profile for specified syntax or use your own profile with specific rules.
trans-unit.target: Define profile for specified syntax or use your own profile with specific rules.

trans-unit.source: An array of languages where Emmet abbreviations should not be expanded.
trans-unit.target: An array of languages where Emmet abbreviations should not be expanded.

trans-unit.source: Path to a folder containing Emmet profiles and snippets.
trans-unit.target: Path to a folder containing Emmet profiles and snippets.

trans-unit.source: Shows expanded Emmet abbreviations as suggestions. The option `"inMarkupAndStylesheetFilesOnly"` applies to html, haml, jade, slim, xml, xsl, css, scss, sass, less and stylus. The option `"always"` applies to all parts of the file regardless of markup/css.
trans-unit.target: Shows expanded Emmet abbreviations as suggestions. The option `"inMarkupAndStylesheetFilesOnly"` applies to html, haml, jade, slim, xml, xsl, css, scss, sass, less and stylus. The option `"always"` applies to all parts of the file regardless of markup/css.

trans-unit.source: Shows possible Emmet abbreviations as suggestions. Not applicable in stylesheets or when emmet.showExpandedAbbreviation is set to `"never"`.
trans-unit.target: Shows possible Emmet abbreviations as suggestions. Not applicable in stylesheets or when emmet.showExpandedAbbreviation is set to `"never"`.

trans-unit.source: Enable Emmet abbreviations in languages that are not supported by default. Add a mapping here between the language and emmet supported language. E.g.: `{"vue-html": "html", "javascript": "javascriptreact"}`
trans-unit.target: Enable Emmet abbreviations in languages that are not supported by default. Add a mapping here between the language and emmet supported language. E.g.: `{"vue-html": "html", "javascript": "javascriptreact"}`

trans-unit.source: Variables to be used in Emmet snippets
trans-unit.target: Variables to be used in Emmet snippets

trans-unit.source: When enabled, Emmet abbreviations are expanded when pressing TAB.
trans-unit.target: When enabled, Emmet abbreviations are expanded when pressing TAB.

trans-unit.source: Preferences used to modify behavior of some actions and resolvers of Emmet.
trans-unit.target: Preferences used to modify behaviour of some actions and resolvers of Emmet.

trans-unit.source: Default unit for integer values
trans-unit.target: Default unit for integer values

trans-unit.source: Default unit for float values
trans-unit.target: Default unit for float values

trans-unit.source: Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations
trans-unit.target: Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations

trans-unit.source: Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations in Sass files
trans-unit.target: Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations in Sass files

trans-unit.source: Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations in Stylus files
trans-unit.target: Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations in Stylus files

trans-unit.source: Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations
trans-unit.target: Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations

trans-unit.source: Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations in Sass files
trans-unit.target: Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations in Sass files

trans-unit.source: Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations in Stylus files
trans-unit.target: Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations in Stylus files

trans-unit.source: If `true`, then Emmet suggestions will show up as snippets allowing you to order them as per `#editor.snippetSuggestions#` setting.
trans-unit.target: If `true`, then Emmet suggestions will show up as snippets allowing you to order them as per `#editor.snippetSuggestions#` setting.

trans-unit.source: Element separator used for classes when using the BEM filter
trans-unit.target: Element separator used for classes when using the BEM filter

trans-unit.source: Modifier separator used for classes when using the BEM filter
trans-unit.target: Modifier separator used for classes when using the BEM filter

trans-unit.source: A definition of comment that should be placed before matched element when comment filter is applied.
trans-unit.target: A definition of comment that should be placed before matched element when comment filter is applied.

trans-unit.source: A definition of comment that should be placed after matched element when comment filter is applied.
trans-unit.target: A definition of comment that should be placed after matched element when comment filter is applied.

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of attribute names that should exist in abbreviation for the comment filter to be applied
trans-unit.target: A comma-separated list of attribute names that should exist in abbreviation for the comment filter to be applied

trans-unit.source: An array of tag names that should not get inner indentation
trans-unit.target: An array of tag names that should not get inner indentation

trans-unit.source: An array of tag names that should always get inner indentation
trans-unit.target: An array of tag names that should always get inner indentation

trans-unit.source: If true, compact notation of boolean attributes are produced
trans-unit.target: If true, compact notation of boolean attributes are produced

trans-unit.source: Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'webkit' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'webkit' prefix.
trans-unit.target: Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'webkit' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'webkit' prefix.

trans-unit.source: Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'moz' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'moz' prefix.
trans-unit.target: Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'moz' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'moz' prefix.

trans-unit.source: Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'o' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'o' prefix.
trans-unit.target: Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'o' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'o' prefix.

trans-unit.source: Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'ms' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'ms' prefix.
trans-unit.target: Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'ms' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'ms' prefix.

trans-unit.source: The minimum score (from 0 to 1) that fuzzy-matched abbreviation should achieve. Lower values may produce many false-positive matches, higher values may reduce possible matches.
trans-unit.target: The minimum score (from 0 to 1) that fuzzy-matched abbreviation should achieve. Lower values may produce many false-positive matches, higher values may reduce possible matches.

trans-unit.source: When set to `false`, the whole file is parsed to determine if current position is valid for expanding Emmet abbreviations. When set to `true`, only the content around the current position in css/scss/less files is parsed.
trans-unit.target: When set to `false`, the whole file is parsed to determine if current position is valid for expanding Emmet abbreviations. When set to `true`, only the content around the current position in css/scss/less files is parsed.
